page.title: 07EMPLOYMENT IN CHIRNSIDE
page.content: Lloyds is a company which sells all the latest in farm machinery, including tractors, trailers, combines, ploughs and harrows. A register in Carlisle is used to supply the firm with their equipment, and all their wares are made in Britain. There is a shop on the premises where people can buy things like 3-wheeler motorbikes, clothes and garden machinery. The property was completely rebuilt in 1983 following a fire. The farms around Chirnside grow mainly grain crops, chiefly barley but also some wheat. Peas, broccoli, sprouts and potatoes are also grown and recently oilseed rape. Beef cattle and sheep are raised. Farming provides full-time and seasonal employment. Building, carpentry, painting and plumbing businesses,the school, shops, garages and hotels provide other work.
